oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session: Operation Song - 2018-11-11
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by songwriters affiliated with Operation Song, an organization that pairs professional songwriters with veterans, active duty military, and their families held in the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on November 11, 2018. Participants include Operation song director and founder Bob Regan, along with Jenn Franklin, Michael Byer, Zarity Croney, Ian Wagner and Dennis Leftrick.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob Regan; Jenn Franklin; Michael Byer; Zarity Croney; Ian Wagner; Dennis Leftrick;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (04:35) Audio from video presentation / (08:43) Opening comments and introduction of Bob Regan by Kayleigh Shoemaker / (10:45) Opening comments by Bob / (12:35) Introduction of the first song / (13:48) Performs The Forgotten Victory (Ian Wagner-vocal) / (17:08) Introduces the next song / (18:55) Performs Over The Wire (Mike Byers-vocal with Nick Reed-guitar) / (21:55) Introduction of the next song / (23:59) Performs unidentified song likely title I Serve (Zarity Croney-vocal with Jenn Franklin-piano) / (29:01) Introduction of the next song / (31:04) Performs That Would Be Ben (Bob Regan-vocal and guitar and Dennis Leftrick-vocal) / (34:46) Comments on the last song / (35:40) Introduction of the next song / (36:58) Performs 21 Guns For 22 (Mike Byers-guitar and vocal with Nick Reed-guitar) / (41:10) Mike Byers talks about a program he founded named SOAR / (43:15) Introduction of the next song / (45:35) Performs Rosie The Riveter (Jenn Franklin-piano and vocal) / (48:55) Bob comments on the song and recognizes military veterans in the audience and the folks who've participated in Operation Song in the past and talks about the program / (52:28) Introduces the next song / (54:07) Performs The USS Arkansas (Bob Regan-guitar and vocal) / (57:15) Talks about the last song / (58:27) Introduction of the next song / (59:36) Performs unidentified song likely titled The Reason For Me (Jenn Freeman-piano and vocal) / (01:03:29) Introduces the next song / (01:03:48) Performs Everyday Should Be Veteran's Day (Bob Regan-guitar and Ian Wagner-vocal) / (01:06:32) Closing comments / (01:06:57) Walk-out music (01:07:24) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Regan, Bob; Franklin, Jenn; Byer, Michael; Croney, Zarity; Wagner, Ian; Leftrick, Dennis; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
